title: Extract Value from Ordered Data with Adjacent Feature Attributes

questions.question: Adjacent feature attributes in FME refer to...
options: The ability to access attribute values for previous and subsequent features.
The ability to concatenate related attribute values.
The ability to identify nearby spatial features.
The ability to join attribute values based on spatial relationships.

questions.question: In which of the following scenarios could you use adjacent feature attributes?
options: You have park features, each with a numerical attribute reporting the annual visitor count. You need to sum all the annual visitor counts to get a total count for all parks.
You need to filter out expired contracts from a list of contracts, where each contract is a feature containing an expiry date attribute.
You need to find the closest hospital to a given location.
You need to process a text file line-by-line while being aware of the contents of the previous line.

questions.question: Which of the following transformers allows you to access adjacent feature attributes?
